results.title: Big city 1980
results.brief_description: In Big City 1980, host Garry Moore presents a discussion on how big cities might be seen in the future by contrasting two cities in the present, Brasilia and the redeveloping city of Philadelphia. The highlight of this program is the amazing futurist city of Brasilia, the capital of Brazil. This instant city was entirely built in a period of 5 years. Every street is an expressway and underpasses eliminate the use of intersections. It is a capital city where government buildings dominate, so this allows a unity in futurist architecture throughout, which looks like a giant set for a science fiction film. Important footage of the city is shown during its development stages. Lucio Costa won the competition for Brasilia’s master plan and Oscar Niemeyer designed the major government building. America’s first planned city of Philadelphia is also profiled along with the controversial plans of redevelopment, which will see the city into the future. Plans made by architects and designers of futurist cities are also shown towards the end of the program. This program was presented on the Tomorrow series by CBS News.

results.title: Big business and the ghost of Confucius
results.creator_credit: Peter Bull, Teleac Holland, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the rise of the South East Asian industrial powers of Taiwan, Singapore and South Korea and their rapid rise to the forefront of the world economy. Through portraits and interviews with business leaders and politicians, including Lee Kwan Yew and the chairman of Hyundai, the program grapples with fundamental questions about the role of government in economic growth, and the way rulers and ruled alike have invoked traditional values of loyalty to the state to meet modern economic goals. A study guide and faculty manual are available to accompany this series.

results.title: Big brown beastie, big brown face
results.brief_description: Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman who has represented Australia in five Olympic games. Tells of his life with horses and competition riding and shows him at a dressage event in Canada. Also covers the Australian Equestrian Team at the Montreal Olympic Games in 1976. Princess Anne appears in a dressage event at the games. Title music by Mike Oldfield. No other credits available.

results.title: Big brother of Christmas Island: Tai Ko Seng [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mathew Kelley, Samantha Kelley, Peter Du Cane and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary explores the significant role Gordon Bennett played in the development of the union movement on Christmas Island. Bennett immigrated from England to Australia and quickly rose in the union ranks. In 1979 he arrived at Christmas Island to help the workers union improve worker conditions. He was responsible for significant changes and during his twelve years became a folk hero to the local inhabitants.

results.title: Big brawl of '36
results.brief_description:
A personal and humorous account of a game between Benambra and Swifts Creek in 1936, where tempers flared and even the umpire was disqualified in the aftermath.

Thank you to Swifts Creek Football Club, ABC Gippsland (Photography Gerard Callinan) and Gordon Bock.

TRANSCRIPT

My first game in 1936 we had to go to Benambra and apparently there were very, very hard feelings between Swifts Creek and Benambra. It came over from the Grand Final the year before, which Swifts Creek won. I came here in September ’35 and they’re still celebrating their win against Benambra and apparently Benambra weren’t happy about it. So, I thought next year, first game next year was out at Benambra and it was sort of an evening up job…

Got to nearly half time an’ developed into a general brawl. I was playing on the wing and I was lucky, my opponent he wasn’t too keen to go in and neither was I, so we looked on. And I thought “By Jesus, they play fair dinkum over ‘ere”. I think there were over ten blokes rubbed out and I think the umpire was alto rubbed out and scrubbed. He happened to be a local bloke here, an’ he’s a great mate of mine but I’d say is the worst umpire I ever seen in my life. He completely lost control of the game altogether. One bloke got rubbed out for life, he was reported for kicking the umpire, somebody kicked the umpire and quite candidly I think he needed kicking meself. And it was in the days of the Depression and there’s a lot of Sustenance workers, Susso’s we used to call ‘em, working on the roads and that’s probably why the standard of football was very good because we had a lot of people came out into the country, poor fellows you know, that were willing to work for their keep an’ their tucker and that sort of thing…an’ they had a big Sustenance worker camp out doing up the Corryong Road and this fellow that got rubbed out for life he was one of them.

But nowadays Benambra an’ the Creek are quite good mates, we get on very well I think, don’t we?

Swifts Creek had a little Rover and apparently he had an enemy at Benambra, he was also a Rover and he said, all of a sudden there’s this bloke he’s down, see, an’ he said I was just gunna race in and slip the boot in and some dirty bugger hit me from behind.

results.title: Big boys don't cry
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions and Tee Bosustow
results.brief_description: A young boy wanders through bushland enjoying nature’s beauty. Carrying a slug gun he initially shoots at a paper cup, however images of TV western gunfights go through his mind and on impulse he takes aim and shoots a bird. Realising what he has done the boy runs away as scenes of real life violence flash before him - scenes of war and innocent killing. The boy makes the decision to return to target shooting. A non-verbal film with b&w sequences. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Big blip, small blip
results.creator_credit: Knox McKenzie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Trained as a radar operator, Knox McKenzie saw himself posted around Australia throughout World War II, and eventually on Melville Island. It was an isolating job, waiting for signal “blips” to pick up planes coming in. A big blip was a friend and a small blip was a foe. McKenzie’s innate independance helped him to see the entire experience as an education and one to remember for the rest of his life.

results.title: Big Bill: the story of a heron
results.creator_credit: RSPB Film and Video Unit, Anthony Bomford and Hugh Miles
results.brief_description: This beautifully photographed film looks at one of the most well-known water-birds, the grey heron. Habitat, nesting, breeding, raising the young and collecting food are aspects of the heron’s life that are examined. Narrated by Eric Thompson.
